column4: hey guys, im more or less wondering a little about the basics of disk access in linux/ubuntu here but: if i write a cron job, that is going to do an ls on 3 directories, and possibly write that to a file, is this going to prevernt my harddrives from going to sleep, or is there some form of disk cacheing that will save me from the above?
oh bummer, so my disks would basically never go to sleep if i set that ?
is there a nice way to 'check' the output of ls?
